channel.title: School Online?
channel.description: Does anyone have school online like classes? Can you point me to a good website because I want to try this out for freshmen year. Thanks.

item.title: School Online?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:1, topic:390859”]I had to take a online course for Spanish. I hated it.

Don’t even bother.[/quote]From what you were talking about on the IRC, it didn’t sound like a normal online class.

But everyone likes different things anyway, so who knows

Read full topic

item.title: School Online?
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

I did online class for part of my High-School. The teachers never explained anything thoroughly, and when you asked them questions it sometimes took a few hours or the next day to get a response. I would not recommend it. Plus you lose the socialism of going to real school, and get the experience from being around all those kids. You will learn more from being around people all day then being in-front of a computer.

Read full topic

item.title: School Online?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Oh, I didn’t read the freshman part. Yes for sure, take one year and see how you like it, then decide what you want to do for sophomore year.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: School Online?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“pk2play, post:5, topic:390839”]Yeah, My math teacher doesn’t teach us crap he gives us the work and doesn’t explain anything.
My English teacher is still teaching about subjects and verbs…
I don’t think it really matters anyway.[/quote]If you need things explained to you well, online classes probably aren’t for you. It’s basically reading out of a book and solving the problems. Note it may be a tad different depending on your program, mine (Advanced Academics) is pretty cool, and has teachers available a lot of the time to explain things to you in chat. Learn a bit about it

Read full topic

item.title: School Online?
item.dc:creator: @pk2play pk2play
item.description:
@pk2play wrote:

Yeah, My math teacher doesn’t teach us crap he gives us the work and doesn’t explain anything.
My English teacher is still teaching about subjects and verbs…
I don’t think it really matters anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: School Online?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Doesn’t matter who does it, just get some information on it.

Also, I can speak from experience that the classes (tend) to be MUCH easier online, but you will miss some parts of real school. I thought I hated every aspect about real school until I didn’t have it anymore. It’s a decision you really need to think about.

Read full topic

item.title: School Online?
item.dc:creator: @pk2play pk2play
item.description:
@pk2play wrote:

Should I have my mom call the counselor?

Read full topic

item.title: School Online?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I take them.

Usually your district will have a program for it, and you’ll need to talk to your counselor. You can’t just decide ‘well ill go sign up for some online classes’ and expect to graduate or get credits. There may be some special websites for your state, who knows. Talk to a district authority figure

Read full topic
